page.title: 02ECOLOGY ROUND WYDDIAL
page.content: Rainfall averages 840mm.per year. East winds can bring problems by drifting snow,blocking roads in winter. The area consists of pleasant undulating countryside, most of which is arable farmland. There are several small blocks of deciduous woodland. The scenery is open and unspectacular. Fields are fairly large. Most of the hedgerows have been removed or cut to ground level, especially in the north and west of the block. In the east small streams feeding the River Quin are bordered by bushes to some extent, but these are small re_growths. Standard trees often show damage from stubble burning.There are many footpaths and bridleways but they have little relevance to present day life except as a means of recreation. Their continued existence depends on the persistence of walkers.
